alert.note: Alert for Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 1:54PM MST until February 24 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 7 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Teller County/Rampart Range Above 7500 Feet/Pikes Peak Between 7500 and 11000 Feet and Pikes Peak Above 11000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An extended period of cold and snow is expected. Very low wind chills are expected tonight and again Wednesday night, with wind chills not rising above zero in some spots during this period. Light to moderate snow, with periods of heavy snow, will likely impact the morning and evening commutes today through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
